oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of a multi-FPGA netlist partitioner and a general purpose graph partitioning system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOWAIKAR, P
SOHONI, M
CHANDRAMOULI, M
PATKAR, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: netlist partitioning
graphs
hypergraphs
eigenspectrum
submodular functions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We describe here a general purpose graph partitioning system, especially suitable for VLSI applications. The partitioner has at its core a spectral based graph partitioner. In our strategy, the input netlist is first coarsened into a smaller netlist and the core spectral partitioner then proceeds to partition this coarsened netlist. This coarse partition is then lifted to a partition of the original netlist. The coarsener is fairly subtle and uses the theory of submodular functions, and of matchings. We also highlight some of our results.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PHOTOMASK AND X-RAY MASK TECHNOLOGY V,3412,252-260
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Conference on Photomask and X-Ray Mask Technology V,KAWASAKI, JAPAN,APR 09-10, 1998
